paragraphs.text:
%md
### Lets calculate interval statistics with Bootstrap method

msg.data: Lets calculate interval statistics with Bootstrap method

paragraphs.text:
import scala.collection.mutable.ArrayBuffer


def generateSample(arr: Array[Double], n: Int): Array[Double] = {
    val buf = new ArrayBuffer[Double]()
    (0 until n).foreach(i => buf += arr((n * random.next).toInt))
    buf.toArray
}

def calcIntervalStatistic(arr: Array[Double], m: Int, statistic: Array[Double] => Double): (Double, Double) = {
    val point_stat = statistic(arr)
    
    val samples = (0 to m).map(i => generateSample(arr, arr.length))
    val statistics = samples.map(statistic).toArray
    val S2 = variance(statistics)
    val s = scala.math.pow(S2, 0.5)
    (point_stat - s, point_stat + s)
}

val EV = df.agg(avg('value)).first.getDouble(0)
val EV2 = scala.math.pow(EV, 2)
val D = df.agg(avg(pow('value, 2) - EV2)).first.getDouble(0)

val df2 = randomDf(N, random, "value2") // Generating a second one sample

val dfid = df.withColumn("id", monotonically_increasing_id)
val dfid2 = df2.withColumn("id", monotonically_increasing_id)

val joined = dfid.join(dfid2, dfid.col("id") === dfid2.col("id"))
val R = joined.agg((avg('value * 'value2) * 12) - 3).first.getDouble(0)

paragraphs.text:
import scala.math.{tan, Pi}

def G(x: Double) = tan(Pi * (x - 0.5))

val Gudf = udf(G(_:Double):Double)
val cauchyDistribution = randomDf(N, random).select(Gudf('value).as("value"))

val a = -5.0
val b = 5.0
val M = 100.0
val interval = (b - a) / M
val groupedDf = cauchyDistribution.filter('value > a && 'value < b).withColumn("interval_start", round((('value - a) / interval).cast(IntegerType) * interval + a, 3)).groupBy('interval_start).agg((count("*") / N.toDouble).as("pi_"))
z.show(groupedDf.sort('interval_start))

calcXi2(cauchyDistribution, 10, CauchyDF, 2, 0.05)

%md
### Lets take a normal distribution from -n to n and generate probability and distribution function values

msg.data: Lets take a normal distribution from -n to n and generate probability and distribution function values

paragraphs.text:
val n = 100
val k = 20.0

def nd(x: Double) = {
    ((1 / scala.math.pow(2 * Pi, 0.5)) * scala.math.exp(-scala.math.pow(x, 2)/2))
}
val p = (-n to n).map(i => nd(i / k)).toList
var s = 0.0
val dfv = p.map(pi => {s += (pi / k); s})

println("%table\nx\ty")
(0 until p.length).foreach(i => println((i - n) / k + "\t" + p(i)))

(0 until p.length).foreach(i => println((i - n) / k + "\t" + p.take(i + 1).sum / k))

%md
### Generating a sample for N values from a to b

msg.data: Generating a sample for N values from a to b

paragraphs.text: val res: List[Double] = (0 until N).map(i => ((dfv.count(_ <= random.next) / k - n / k) * 1000).round / 1000.0).toList

import org.apache.spark.sql.types._
import org.apache.spark.sql.Row

val df = spark.createDataFrame(
    spark.sparkContext.parallelize(res).map(t => Row(t)), 
    StructType(
        Seq(
            StructField("value", DataTypes.DoubleType, false)
            )
    )
)

z.show(df.withColumn("value", 'value).groupBy('value).count.sort('value))

%md
### Calculating interval Mean and Variance intervals

msg.data: Calculating interval Mean and Variance intervals

paragraphs.text:
import breeze.stats.distributions.Gaussian

def GaussianDF(x: Double) = Gaussian(0, 0.05299066958918639).probability(Double.MinValue, x) // Gaussian distribution function

calcXi2(df, 20, GaussianDF, 2, 0.05)
